entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 1:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rising Water Levels on Rivers Draining the Brooks Range... Several weather fronts moving across the eastern Brooks Range will bring rising water levels to rivers and streams. Additional rainfall totals from 0.50 to 1.00 inches are possible through Friday. Some isolated locations could see higher amounts. Water levels are expected to remain within bank and below flood stage.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 8:16AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER LEVELS REMAIN HIGH... Water levels along the Mendenhall Lake and River in Juneau remain elevated and near bankfull due to previous days heavy rainfall. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:01PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THUNDERSTORMS PRODUCING HEAVY RAIN ARE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE BOUNDARY WATERS CANOE AREA WILDERNESS TODAY AND TONIGHT... Multiple rounds of thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rain will be possible this afternoon and tonight across the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness. The main impacts from the storms will be frequent cloud-to-ground lightning and locally heavy

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 3:41PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FUNNEL CLOUDS POSSIBLE ACROSS EASTERN NORTH DAKOTA... Showers and thunderstorms have developed across eastern North Dakota this afternoon. Conditions are favorable for funnel clouds with any thunderstorm that does develop. These types of funnel clouds are usually short lived, however, they can and occasionally do touch the ground and cause minor damage.
